rev.comment: /* Nov 3 traffic incident */ new source-- victims have gone on-record saying they believe it was criminal
rev.diff:
Line 168: Line 168:
===Nov 3 traffic incident===
===Nov 3 traffic incident===
â
On November 3, a driver of a Mercedes who had a green light struck two protestors who were in the street blocking traffic. The two protestors were taken to the hospital with minor injuries. The driver was questioned by BART police and released, angering protesters who witnessed the events and called for the driver's arrest. <ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Matthai|title=Mercedes hits 2 Occupy Oakland protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/03/BA5G1LQ06S.DTL|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
+
On November 3, a silver Mercedes-Benz driving southbound on 11th encountered a stream of protestors walking along Broadway. Two of the protestors, Margaret So and Lance Laverdure, were struck and transported to the hospital. The driver was questioned by BART police and released, angering nearby witnesses who called for the driver's arrest. <ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Matthai|title=Mercedes hits 2 Occupy Oakland protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/03/BA5G1LQ06S.DTL|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
  +
On November 11, the two victims held a press conference alleging that the incident was criminal act and questioning why police had not prosecuted the driver. Lance Laverdure, one of the victims, told press that "We want this person arrested for the attempted murder of myself and Margaret". <ref>KGO [http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8429027#&cmp=twi-kgo-article-8429027 Protesters hit by car press for driver's arrest]</ref>
==Chronology of events==
==Chronology of events==
